title: So what happened to the 'gravitate upwards' in ranked?
body:
In the past, if you went 50/50 in ranked you would still move slowly up the ranks, due to slightly more LP given for a win in your MMR bracket than a loss. 

But now its completely random, you get 18 or 20 LP (like those are pretty much tho only numbers it gives) and its has no relation win or loss or anything.

i went on a massive winning streak, and every single win only gave me 18 (so its not an MMR thing) and sometimes when i lose it gives me 18 and sometimes 20.

Its hard enough to escape bronze AGAIN, so why make it harder by punishing a loss harder this season. 

I got out of bronze last season, and this season i get put right back at the bottom again and need to do it all again, why? its pointless, and frustrating. 

what happened to the 50/50 gravitate upwards thing? Im above 50/50 win rate and still aren't going anywhere.

replies.body:
You're wrong.

Thanks for posting though.

Bye.

The more games you play with a 0-50% win rate, the less LP you will earn for winning. You need to improve your play to at least a 55% to start climbing. If you're winning something like 70-90% of your games you will start to get a lot of LP from wins, until you start losing again and you stabilize at that rank.

50/50 never meant you'd climb, and statistically speaking it shouldn't anyway. If you are winning 50% of your games then it means you are where you are meant to be, and will stay there. To climb you need a positive win rate, and to fall you need a negative one. 

Of course there are exceptions, until you've played a decent number of ranked games it's a bit inaccurate since an early win or loss streak will skew your win rate. But generally speaking if you have a 50% win rate then your true mmr matches where you are, and you ought to be losing/gaining about the same amount of LP.

The only way you'd be climbing with 50/50 would be if your mmr was way higher than your tier, and that would even out pretty quick.

LP gain is dependent on your MMR compared to the MMR of players in your division. If you're gaining less LP than you're losing, there's not much you can do except continue to win more games to increase your MMR. Or you could try dodging tricks...?

Also climbing can be easier/take less games this season because of the promo helper. I could have been stuck failing several promos without it.
